thread.title: The Skin-Nourishing Benefits of Shea Butter: A Nutrition Professional's Guide
thread.title_full: The Skin-Nourishing Benefits of Shea Butter: A Nutrition Professional's Guide

author: VNExplorer
title: The Skin-Nourishing Benefits of Shea Butter: A Nutrition Professional's Guide
text: Shea Butter image Expert opinion from Caroline Luiza C. Castro Master’s in Nutrition Sciences · 16 years of experience · Brazil Shea butter is strongly recommended to improve moisture skin. Actually, its beneficial for many kinds of skin problems, reducing inflammation and also prescribed in some cases of atopic dermatitis. For skin care, shea butter has been used since decades, but to be eaten, in Brazil this kind of butter isn’t popular. Despite having benefits for skin care, some articles also describe shea butter beneficial as a substitute of common butter, reducing inflammation, for example. Expert opinion from Leticia Soares Postgraduate Degree in Public and Family Health/Bachelor Degree in Nutrition and Dietetics · 5 years of experience · Brazil Shea butter in its raw and unrefined version is high in nutrients such as vitamin A and vitamin E and essential fatty acids. It is recommended to use shea butter on the skin, hair, nails and cuticles whenever a deep hydration is desired. Shea butter can help prevent and improve skin problems, such as atopic dermatitis and premature aging, regenerating and strengthening its hydration and softness. → See more questions and expert answers related to Shea Butter. Expert opinion from Marcelli F. Chagas Bachelor in Nutrition · 1 years of experience · Brazil Shea butter is able to prevent and improve skin problems, such as atopic dermatitis, stretch marks and even premature aging, regenerating and strengthening its hydration and softness. This compound can also be used on the nail and lip area to treat dryness. |What are people curious about?| |Mediterranean diet||Keto diet| |Diabetic diet||Weight loss| Disclaimer: This is for information purpose only, and should not be considered as a substitute for medical expertise. These are opinions from an external panel of individual doctors or nutritionists and not to be considered as opinion of Microsoft. Please seek professional help regarding any health conditions or concerns. Medical advice varies across region. Advice from professionals outside your region should be used at your own discretion.
